intro: Reseda luteola subsp. dimerocarpa, commonly known as the yellow ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae and typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, and it can be distinguished by its distinctive seed capsules that split open to release seeds. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
